subject: improve your QS reading speed with Dictator
msgSnippet: I ve been  using a  program called Dictator  to incrementally  my TO reading speed and now I ve just realized that it can be used with QS as well. The way
messageBody:
I've been using a program called Dictator to incrementally my TO
reading speed and now I've just realized that it can be used with QS
as well.

The way Dictator works is by displaying a single word on the screen
and moving to the next word after an adjustable delay.

It's a strange way to read, but I've found that by reading this way
and gradually decreasing the delay between the displayed words my TO
reading speed has gone up a bit... or at least it seems that way to
me. :)

To be honest, I've only used Dictator a handful of times, and
haven't quantified the reading speed improvement I've achieved...
but, at the least, Dictator is a neat little gizmo. :) And it works
with QS!

Anyway, here's Dictator's web page:

http://dictator.kieranholland.com/dictator.html

And here's how it looks using the Thoth font:

http://img299.imageshack.us/img299/6421/dictatorlg9.jpg

The way I got it to work with QS is by writing up a QS text in
OpenOffice using the Thoth font, saving the file as text, and
loading the text file in to Dictator. You'll also need to switch
Dictator's fonts to Thoth. You can find Dictator's font selection
dialogs under:

* Options->MonoWord Display->Font...
* Options->Text Display->Regular Font...
* Options->Text Display->Hilight Font...

Good luck,

--Sergey
